Class ShipManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.model.managers.ShipManager
public class ShipManager extends Object
The ShipManager class is responsible for managing the components and crew of a spaceship in the Galaxy Trucker game. It provides high-level operations for adding, removing, and managing ship components while ensuring game rules and constraints are met.

This class acts as a controller that interacts with the underlying ShipBoard, translating board coordinates into tile matrix coordinates, handling the placement and removal of components, and enforcing constraints related to crew, aliens, engines, and cargo.

Main functionalities include:

  • Managing the ship's grid layout based on game level.
  • Adding and removing components while ensuring legal placement.
  • Handling crew members, including human and alien placement with life support checks.
  • Tracking energy sources such as batteries.
  • Calculating ship attributes such as firepower and engine power.

The ship is represented internally by an instance of ShipBoard, which maintains the actual grid structure and components.

Example of usage:

 ShipManager manager = new ShipManager(1); // Initialize for level 1
 manager.addComponentTile(2, 3, new EngineModule());
 manager.addCrewmate(2, 3, new Human());
 boolean isValid = manager.isShipLegal();
Version:
1.5
Author:
Stefano Carletto

      public static int getRows()
      Returns the total number of rows in the ship's grid.

      This method provides access to the number of rows defined in the ShipManager.

      Returns:
      The total number of rows in the ship's grid.

    • getColumns

      public static int getColumns()
      Returns the total number of columns in the ship's grid.

      This method provides access to the number of columns defined in the ShipManager.

      Returns:
      The total number of columns in the ship's grid.

    • getComponent

      public Optional<ComponentTile> getComponent(int row, int column) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Retrieves the component located at the specified position in the ship's grid.

      This method returns an Optional containing the ComponentTile at the given row and column coordinates, if present. If no component exists at the specified location, an empty Optional is returned.

      If the specified row or column is out of the valid bounds of the ship, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the component to retrieve.
      column - The column index of the component to retrieve.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the ComponentTile if present, or empty if no component exists.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row or column is out of the ship's bounds.

    • isOutside

      public boolean isOutside(int row, int column) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException

    • getComponentsAtRow

      public List<Optional<ComponentTile>> getComponentsAtRow(int row) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Retrieves all components located in the specified row of the ship's grid.

      This method returns a list of Optional elements, each representing a ComponentTile located at the given row and every column in the ship's grid. If a position does not contain a component, the corresponding Optional will be empty.

      If the specified row is out of the valid bounds of the ship, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      row - The row index for which to retrieve all components.
      Returns:
      A list of Optional<ComponentTile> representing the components in the specified row.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row is out of the ship's bounds.

    • getComponentsAtColumn

      public List<Optional<ComponentTile>> getComponentsAtColumn(int column) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Retrieves all components located in the specified column of the ship's grid.

      This method returns a list of Optional elements, each representing a ComponentTile located at the given column and every row in the ship's grid. If a position does not contain a component, the corresponding Optional will be empty.

      If the specified column is out of the valid bounds of the ship, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      column - The column index for which to retrieve all components.
      Returns:
      A list of Optional<ComponentTile> representing the components in the specified column.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified column is out of the ship's bounds.

    • getAllComponentsType

      public Set<Class<? extends ComponentTile>> getAllComponentsType()
      Retrieves the set of all distinct component types present in the ship.

      This method returns a Set containing the Class objects of all ComponentTile types currently placed in the ship. Each entry in the set represents a unique type of component found on the ship's grid.

      If no components are present in the ship, this method returns an empty set.

      Returns:
      A Set of Class objects representing the distinct component types in the ship, or an empty set if no components are present.

    • getAllComponentsPositionOfType

      public Set<List<Integer>> getAllComponentsPositionOfType(Class<? extends ComponentTile> componentType)
      Retrieves the positions of all components of a specified type in board coordinates.

      This method returns a Set of positions where components of the given type are located. Each position is represented as a List of two integers (row and column). The positions are converted from tile matrix coordinates to board coordinates using toBoardCoord(Optional, Optional).

      If no components of the specified type are found, an empty set is returned.

      Parameters:
      componentType - The Class type of the ComponentTile to search for.
      Returns:
      A Set of List elements representing the positions of the matching components in board coordinates.

    • getDisconnectedBranches

      public List<Set<List<Integer>>> getDisconnectedBranches()
      Retrieves the disconnected branches of the ship, represented in board coordinates.

      A disconnected branch is a set of tiles that are not connected to the main ship structure. This method calls ShipBoard.getDisconnectedBranches() to obtain the branches in tile matrix coordinates and then converts them into board coordinates.

      The result is a list of sets, where each set represents a disconnected branch. Each position in the set is a list of two integers: the row and column of a component in board coordinates.

      Example of usage: 

       invalid input: '{@code
 List<Set<List<Integer>>> branches = shipManager.getDisconnectedBranches();
 for (Set<List<Integer>> branch : branches) {
     System.out.println("Disconnected branch: " + branch);
 }
 </pre>

 @return A list of sets, where each set represents a disconnected branch.'

    • addComponentTile

      public void addComponentTile(int row, int column, ComponentTile component) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IllegalComponentPositionException
      Adds a component tile to the specified position in the ship's grid.

      This method places a given ComponentTile at the specified row and column coordinates. If the position is out of bounds or if the component cannot be placed in the given location due to structural constraints, an exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      row - The row index where the component should be placed.
      column - The column index where the component should be placed.
      component - The ComponentTile to be added to the ship.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row or column is out of the ship's bounds.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If the component is typing to be placed outside the ship.

    • removeComponentTile

      public void removeComponentTile(int row, int column) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IllegalComponentPositionException
      Removes a component tile from the specified position in the ship's grid.

      This method removes the ComponentTile located at the given row and column coordinates. If the removed component affects other game elements, appropriate updates are made.

      Special cases:

      • If the removed component is a CentralCabin containing a crew, the crew is removed.
      • If the removed component is a LifeSupport module, any nearby aliens that depend on it are also removed.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the component to be removed.
      column - The column index of the component to be removed.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row or column is out of the ship's bounds.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If there is no component at the specified position.

    • removeBranch

      public void removeBranch(Set<List<Integer>> branch) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IllegalComponentPositionException
      Removes a specified branch of components from the ship.

      This method takes a set of coordinates representing a disconnected branch in board coordinates and removes the corresponding components from the ship.

      The given board coordinates are first converted to tile matrix coordinates before calling ShipBoard.removeBranch(Set) to remove the branch.

      Example of usage: 

       
 Set<List<Integer>> branch = Set.of(
         List.of(5, 6),
         List.of(5, 7),
         List.of(6, 7));
 shipManager.removeBranch(branch);
      Parameters:
      branch - A set of positions representing the branch to remove, where each position is a list containing two integers (row and column) in board coordinates.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any coordinate is out of the ship's valid bounds.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If a specified coordinate does not correspond to a valid component.

    • isShipLegal

      public boolean isShipLegal()
      Determines whether the ship's construction is legal according to the game rules.

      The method verifies several conditions to ensure that the ship meets the requirements:

      • The ship must not be divided into disconnected sections.
      • All SingleEngine and DoubleEngine components must be oriented backwards (rotation must be 0).
      • All connectors between adjacent components must be compatible.
      If any of these conditions are not met, the ship is considered illegal.

      Returns:
      true if the ship is legal, false otherwise.

    • addCrewmate

      public void addCrewmate(int row, int column, Human crewmate) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IllegalComponentPositionException, InvalidActionException
      Adds a human crewmate to a specified position within the ship.

      This method attempts to place a given Human crewmate at the specified row and column coordinates on the ship. The following conditions are checked:

      • The target position must contain a valid CentralCabin instance; otherwise, an IllegalComponentPositionException is thrown.
      • If no component exists at the specified position, an IllegalComponentPositionException is thrown.

      If all conditions are met, the human crewmate is added to the cabin.

      Parameters:
      row - The row index where the crewmate should be placed.
      column - The column index where the crewmate should be placed.
      crewmate - The Human crewmate to be added to the cabin.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row or column is out of the ship's bounds.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If the target position does not contain a valid cabin module.
      InvalidActionException - If the cabin is full.

    • addCrewmate

      public void addCrewmate(int row, int column, Alien crewmate) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IllegalComponentPositionException, InvalidActionException
      Adds an alien crewmate to a specified position within the ship.

      This method attempts to place a given Alien crewmate at the specified row and column coordinates on the ship. Before adding the alien, the following conditions are checked:

      • An alien of the same type has not already been placed. If an alien of this type is already present, an InvalidActionException is thrown.
      • The target position must contain a valid CabinModule; otherwise, an IllegalComponentPositionException is thrown.
      • A compatible LifeSupport module must be adjacent to the cabin. If not, an InvalidActionException is thrown.

      If all conditions are met, the alien is added to the cabin, and its type is recorded to prevent placing another alien of the same type.

      Parameters:
      row - The row index where the crewmate should be placed.
      column - The column index where the crewmate should be placed.
      crewmate - The Alien crewmate to be added to the cabin.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row or column is out of the ship's bounds.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If the target position does not contain a valid cabin module.
      InvalidActionException - If an alien of this type is already present or if no compatible life support module is adjacent or if the cabin is full.

    • removeCrewmate

      public void removeCrewmate(int row, int column) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IllegalComponentPositionException, InvalidActionException
      Removes a crewmate from the specified position within the ship.

      This method attempts to remove a crewmate from the cabin located at the specified row and column coordinates. The following conditions are checked:

      • The target position must contain a valid CentralCabin instance; otherwise, an IllegalComponentPositionException is thrown.
      • If no component exists at the specified position, an IllegalComponentPositionException is thrown.

      If the removed crewmate is an alien requiring life support, the alien type is marked as no longer present in the ship.

      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the cabin from which the crewmate should be removed.
      column - The column index of the cabin from which the crewmate should be removed.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row or column is out of the ship's bounds.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If there is no component at the specified position or if the component is not an instance of CentralCabin.
      InvalidActionException - If the cabin has no crew.

    • addCargo

      public void addCargo(int row, int column, Cargo cargo) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IllegalComponentPositionException, InvalidActionException
      Adds a cargo item to a cargo holder at the specified position within the ship.

      This method attempts to place a given Cargo at the specified row and column coordinates on the ship. If the cargo is special, it must be placed in a SpecialCargoHold. If the target position does not contain the correct type of cargo holder, an exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      row - The row index where the cargo should be placed.
      column - The column index where the cargo should be placed.
      cargo - The Cargo to be added to the cargo hold.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row or column is out of the ship's bounds.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If the target position does not contain a cargo holder or if the cargo type is not compatible with the cargo holder type.
      InvalidActionException - If the cargo holder is full.

    • removeCargo

      public void removeCargo(int row, int column, Color color) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IllegalComponentPositionException, InvalidActionException
      Removes a cargo item of the specified color from a cargo hold at the given position.

      This method attempts to remove a Cargo item that matches the given Color from the cargo hold located at the specified row and column coordinates on the ship. If the cargo color is red, the method expects a SpecialCargoHold. If the correct type of cargo hold is not present, or if no cargo of the specified color is found, an exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the cargo hold.
      column - The column index of the cargo hold.
      color - The Color of the cargo to be removed.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row or column is out of the ship's bounds.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If the target position does not contain a cargo hold or if the cargo type is not compatible with the cargo hold type.
      InvalidActionException - If no cargo of the specified color is found or if the cargo holder is empty.

    • removeBattery

      public void removeBattery(int row, int column) throws IllegalComponentPositionException, InvalidActionException
      Removes a battery component from the specified position within the ship.

      This method attempts to remove a battery from the module located at the specified row and column coordinates on the ship. If the component does not exist or is not a BatteryComponent, an exception is thrown.

      The method does not physically remove the battery component but instead triggers energy consumption within it.

      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the battery module.
      column - The column index of the battery module.
      Throws:
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If there is no component at the specified position or if the component is not a BatteryComponent.
      InvalidActionException - If the component has no battery left.

    • getCargoPositon

      public HashMap<Color,Set<List<Integer>>> getCargoPositon()
      Retrieves the positions of all cargo items aboard the ship, grouped by color.

      This method scans all cargo hold components (CargoHold and SpecialCargoHold) and collects the positions of cargo items based on their color.

      The result is a HashMap where each key is a Color representing a cargo type, and the corresponding value is a set of positions (row and column) where cargo of that color is stored.

      Functionality:

      • Iterates over all colors defined in Color.
      • Scans all SpecialCargoHold components for special cargo.
      • Scans all CargoHold components for non-special cargo.
      • Groups the cargo positions by color.

      Example of usage:

           HashMapinvalid input: '<'Color, Setinvalid input: '<'List>> cargoPositions = shipManager.getCargoPosition();
     for (Map.Entryinvalid input: '<'Color, Setinvalid input: '<'List>> entry : cargoPositions.entrySet()) {
         System.out.println("Color: " + entry.getKey() + ", Positions: " + entry.getValue());
     }
      Returns:
      A HashMap where the key is a Color, and the value is a Set of positions (row, column) where cargo of that color is stored.

    • countExposedConnectorsOf

      public int countExposedConnectorsOf(int row, int column) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Counts the number of exposed connectors of the component at the specified position.

      This method determines how many connectors of the ComponentTile at the given row and column are exposed, meaning they are not connected to a compatible neighbor.

      If the specified row or column is out of bounds, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the component.
      column - The column index of the component.
      Returns:
      The number of exposed connectors of the component at the specified position. If the position is empty or outside the board, returns 0
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row or column is out of the ship's bounds.

    • countAllExposedConnectors

      public int countAllExposedConnectors() throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Counts the total number of exposed connectors across all components in the ship.

      This method iterates over all component types present in the ship and accumulates the number of exposed connectors for each component. A connector is considered exposed if it is not connected to a compatible neighboring component.

      Components of type OutOfBoundsTile are ignored in this calculation.

      Returns:
      The total number of exposed connectors in the ship.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If an invalid coordinate is encountered during the computation.

    • hasExposedConnectorAtDirection

      public boolean hasExposedConnectorAtDirection(int row, int column, Direction direction)

    • countHumans

      public int countHumans()
      Counts the total number of human crewmates aboard the ship.

      This method iterates through all CentralCabin and CabinModule components to count the number of human crewmates present. A crewmate is considered human if they do not require life support.

      The method first collects all crewmates in CentralCabin components, as they are exclusively human. Then, it checks each crewmate in CabinModule components and includes only those that do not require life support.

      Returns:
      The total number of human crewmates aboard the ship.

    • hasAlien

      public boolean hasAlien(AlienType type)

    • countCrewmates

      public int countCrewmates()
      Counts the total number of crewmates aboard the ship.

      This method iterates through all CentralCabin and CabinModule components to count the number of crewmates present. Crewmates can be either human or alien.

      The method first collects all crewmates from CentralCabin components, then continues by counting those in CabinModule components.

      Returns:
      The total number of crewmates aboard the ship.

    • calculateFirePower

      public double calculateFirePower()
      Calculates the total firepower of the ship.

      This method computes the total firepower by summing the base firepower of all SingleCannon components present on the ship.

      Firepower Calculation:

      • Retrieves all SingleCannon components aboard the ship.
      • Sum their individual firepower values.
      • If a AlienType.PURPLEALIEN is present, an additional bonus of +2 firepower is applied.

      Example of usage:

           double totalFirePower = shipManager.calculateFirePower();
     System.out.println("Total firepower: " + totalFirePower);
      Returns:
      The total firepower of the ship. Returns 0.0 if no cannons are present.

    • calculateEnginePower

      public int calculateEnginePower()
      Calculates the total engine power of the ship.

      This method computes the total engine power by summing the power values of all SingleEngine components present on the ship.

      Engine Power Calculation:

      • Retrieves all SingleEngine components aboard the ship.
      • Summates their individual engine power values.
      • If a AlienType.BROWNALIEN is present, an additional bonus of +2 engine power is applied.

      Example of usage:

           int totalEnginePower = shipManager.calculateEnginePower();
     System.out.println("Total engine power: " + totalEnginePower);
      Returns:
      The total engine power of the ship. Returns 0 if no engines are present.

    • activateComponent

      public double activateComponent(HashMap<List<Integer>,List<Integer>> componentAndBatteries) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, InvalidActionException, IllegalComponentPositionException
      Activates a set of components using specified battery components.

      This method allows activating multiple EnergyConsumer components by consuming energy from associated BatteryComponent modules. Each activation is represented by a mapping between a component's position and the corresponding battery's position.

      Activation Process:

      • Iterates over the provided mapping of component coordinates to battery coordinates.
      • Verifies that both the target component and the battery exist at their respective positions.
      • Ensures that the target component implements EnergyConsumer.
      • Activates the component and accumulates the resulting power.
      • Consumes energy from the specified BatteryComponent.

      Example of usage:

           HashMapinvalid input: '<'List, List> activations = new HashMapinvalid input: '<'>();
     activations.put(List.of(2, 3), List.of(1, 4)); // Activate component at (2,3) using battery at (1,4)

     double totalPower = shipManager.activateComponent(activations);
     System.out.println("Total activated power: " + totalPower);
      Parameters:
      componentAndBatteries - A mapping between the coordinates of components to be activated and the coordinates of their corresponding battery components.
      Returns:
      The total power generated by all activated components.
      Throws:
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If any of the specified positions do not contain valid components.
      InvalidActionException - If any component is not an EnergyConsumer, if the battery component is invalid, or if activation fails.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If any of the specified positions does not contain a valid component.
      IndexOutOfBoundsException

    • calculateFirePower

      public double calculateFirePower(HashMap<List<Integer>,List<Integer>> doubleCannonsAndBatteries) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, InvalidActionException, IllegalComponentPositionException
      Calculates the total firepower of the ship, including activated double cannons.

      This method computes the base firepower from all SingleCannon components and adds the additional firepower generated by activating DoubleCannon components using batteries.

      Firepower Calculation:

      • Retrieves the base firepower from existing SingleCannon components.
      • Checks if any firepower is present before activation.
      • Activates DoubleCannon components using the provided battery mappings.
      • If no cannons were active before activation, but at least one was activated, and the ship has a AlienType.PURPLEALIEN, an additional +2 firepower bonus is applied.

      Example of usage:

           HashMapinvalid input: '<'List, List> activations = new HashMapinvalid input: '<'>();
     activations.put(List.of(2, 3), List.of(1, 4)); // Activate double cannon at (2,3) using battery at (1,4)

     double totalFirepower = shipManager.calculateFirePower(activations);
     System.out.println("Total firepower: " + totalFirepower);
      Parameters:
      doubleCannonsAndBatteries - A mapping between the coordinates of DoubleCannon components and the coordinates of their corresponding battery components.
      Returns:
      The total firepower of the ship, including activated cannons and any alien bonuses.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any of the specified coordinates are out of bounds.
      InvalidActionException - If any of the components cannot be activated or if an invalid battery is provided.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If any of the specified positions do not contain valid components.

    • calculateEnginePower

      public int calculateEnginePower(HashMap<List<Integer>,List<Integer>> doubleEnginesAndBatteries) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, InvalidActionException, IllegalComponentPositionException
      Calculates the total engine power of the ship, including activated double engines.

      This method computes the base engine power from all SingleEngine components and adds the additional power generated by activating DoubleEngine components using batteries.

      Engine Power Calculation:

      • Retrieves the base engine power from existing SingleEngine components.
      • Checks if any engine power is present before activation.
      • Activates DoubleEngine components using the provided battery mappings.
      • If no engines were active before activation, but at least one was activated, and the ship has a AlienType.BROWNALIEN, an additional +2 engine power bonus is applied.

      Example of usage:

           HashMapinvalid input: '<'List, List> activations = new HashMapinvalid input: '<'>();
     activations.put(List.of(3, 2), List.of(2, 3)); // Activate double engine at (3,2) using battery at (2,3)

     int totalEnginePower = shipManager.calculateEnginePower(activations);
     System.out.println("Total engine power: " + totalEnginePower);
      Parameters:
      doubleEnginesAndBatteries - A mapping between the coordinates of DoubleEngine components and the coordinates of their corresponding battery components.
      Returns:
      The total engine power of the ship, including activated engines and any alien bonuses.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any of the specified coordinates are out of bounds.
      InvalidActionException - If any of the components cannot be activated or if an invalid battery is provided.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If any of the specified positions do not contain valid components.
